column4: so um...i have a problem. I used some program called "Remove Orphaned Packages" and it removed alot of packages and now half of my stuff is missing. can someone do a private chat with me please?
so um...i have a problem. I used some program called "Remove Orphaned Packages" and it removed alot of packages and now half of my stuff is missing. can someone do a private chat with me please?
ok, well chatting here is fine too, i just figure chatting in private message would be easier for troubleshooting.

i've had problems with ubuntu ever since the day I installed it. if it's not one problem it's another. But i used some software called "Remove Orphaned Packages" it removed alot of stuff i am using right now, and now alot of my apps won't run, everything looks different, and icons are missing.
i have no idea how to do that
i'm a computer technician with the navy, but i only know windows
how would i go about doing a "repair install" on my OS? (I have 9.10 test for ubuntu)
>_> why doesn't ubuntu have the system restore option? like, if i install something there's nothing to restore my system to before i did that or to another specific date.
there are several applications able to do that, but none installed by default.
exactly what packages did you remove with the orphan-clean-thingy?
did you have a lot of packages installed without using a repository (i.e. downloaded deb files) or from a repository which are no longer enabled?
aptitude is a higher-level program with a semi-gui available, it also tends to give you more information compared to apt-get...
did your desktop include a menubar at the top.
or rather, are you using Kubuntu rather than the gnome-based ubuntu.
using tab-completion makes spelling mistakes rarer ;)
